Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 63.4% similarity toPlectasin.Activity: Active against S. aureus AB94004 (MIC 9 ug/mL). Kv1.2 potassiumchannel inhibitor: 1000 nM Bldesin inhibited about 40% Kv1.3 channel currents in the electrophysiological experiment system (cf. 100 nM BmKTX inhibited about 80% Kv1.3 channel currents). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Luo X, Zhu W, Ding L, Ye X, Gao H, Tai X, Wu Z, Qian Y, Ruan X, Li J, Li S, Chen Z.2018
Literature Information.Reference: J Biochem Mol Toxicol. 2018 Nov 1:e22244. doi: 10.1002/jbt.22244.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Bldesin, the first functionally characterized pathogenic fungus defensin with Kv1.3 channel and chymotrypsin inhibitory activities.
